comment.text: Cotransporter which plays a role in lipoprotein, vitamin and iron metabolism, by facilitating their uptake. Binds to ALB, MB, Kappa and lambda-light chains, TF, hemoglobin, GC, SCGB1A1, APOA1, high density lipoprotein, and the GIF-cobalamin complex. The binding of all ligands requires calcium. Serves as important transporter in several absorptive epithelia, including intestine, renal proximal tubules and embryonic yolk sac. Interaction with LRP2 mediates its trafficking throughout vesicles and facilitates the uptake of specific ligands like GC, hemoglobin, ALB, TF and SCGB1A1. Interaction with AMN controls its trafficking to the plasma membrane and facilitates endocytosis of ligands. May play an important role in the development of the peri-implantation embryo through internalization of APOA1 and cholesterol. Binds to LGALS3 at the maternal-fetal interface.

Interacts with LRP2 in a dual-receptor complex in a calcium-dependent manner. Component of the cubam complex composed of CUBN and AMN. The cubam complex can oligomerize and form cubam trimers. Found in a complex with PID1/PCLI1, LRP1 and CUBNI. Interacts with LRP1 and PID1/PCLI1.
Colocalizes with AMN and LRP2 in the endocytotic apparatus of epithelial cells.
Expressed in kidney proximal tubule cells, placenta, visceral yolk-sac cells and in absorptive intestinal cells. Expressed in the epithelium of intestine and kidney.
The CUB domains 5 to 8 mediate binding to GIF and ALB. CUB domains 1 and 2 mediate interaction with LRP2.
The precursor is cleaved by a trans-Golgi proteinase furin. The result is a propeptide cleaved off.

disease.name: Recessive hereditary megaloblastic anemia 1
disease.description: Due to selective malabsorption of vitamin B12. Defects in vitamin B12 absorption lead to impaired function of thymidine synthase. As a consequence DNA synthesis is interrupted. Rapidly dividing cells involved in erythropoiesis are particularly affected.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Cobalamin (Cbl, vitamin B12) transport and metabolism
Defective AMN causes hereditary megaloblastic anemia 1
Defective CUBN causes hereditary megaloblastic anemia 1
C:extrinsic component of external side of plasma membrane

entry.keyword: Cleavage on pair of basic residues

feature.description: In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation.
In RH-MGA1; decreases strongly the GIF binding affinity; dbSNP:rs121434430.
Higher frequency in West Africans than in individuals of European ancestry; occurs with variants V-2984 and G-3002 only in individuals of European ancestry; dbSNP:rs62619939.
In a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs529856485.
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs45551835.

Not found in West Africans; occurs with variants F-2153 and G-3002 only in individuals of European ancestry; associated with albuminuria in individuals of European ancestry and African Americans, both with and without diabetes; associated with 42% increased risk of developing persistent microalbuminuria in individuals with type I diabetes; dbSNP:rs1801239.
Higher frequency in West Africans than in individuals of European ancestry; occurs with variants F-2153 and V-2984 only in individuals of European ancestry; dbSNP:rs1801240.
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs111265129.
Found in a renal cell carcinoma case; somatic mutation.
